intro: Schizoglossum commixtum, commonly known as the mixed-flowered schizoglossum, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, which includes bellflowers, and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky slopes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and somewhat woody. Schizoglossum commixtum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is occasionally cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
